fields.headline: Ju-on: The Grudge 2
fields.bodyText: Takashi Shimizu has directed umpteen incarnations of the popular 'Ju-on' horror series, including a couple of straight-to-video movies, two Japanese features, an English-language remake, and a forthcoming sequel. 2003's Ju-on: The Grudge 2 is the second Japanese feature (a third is in now in the pipeline) and has the usual blend of lank-haired women, ghostly, white-skinned children and baffling spiralling narrative. There are a few chills - and occasional laughs - to be had from this post-Wes Craven's New Nightmare tale of a scream-queen actress sent to report from a haunted house. But the sense that Shimizu is simply repeating himself is as hard to exorcise as the titular curse. Isn't it time the director, who clearly has an eye for the uncanny, broadened his horizons?
